channel.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
channel.description:
Well I fixed the other problems I had with Thread Per Client, but this one seems to have me stumped.......
[code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000 at java.lang.String.getBytes(Unknown Source) at stream.writeString(stream.java:203) at client.sendQuest(client.java:1092) at client.GtlvlfrXp(client.java:2613) at client.refreshSkills(client.java:2624) at client.initialize(client.java:2642) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:257) at server.main(server.java:42)[/code]
I am not sure what I have to do to fix this?

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Ok so, let me get this straight, IOClient is handing player login correct?
If so, it may be that loading from another class is causing some of your stream methods to function improperly.
It looks like quite a few methods from your stream class don’t work right with the new method of login. I haven’t the slightest idea how to fix it, but I’m positive player login via IOClient is your problem. Sorry I couldn’t be of more assistance.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

That’s the whole source.

Could your just attach your server.java so I might have a look at it?

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote author=QuestMaster 2K10 link=topic=433492.msg3183417#msg3183417 date=1271524942]

pl0x15:

Alright I didnt look at you’re real problem or anything and not sure how to fix. But go to the latest thing you edited, which is what I do. And see if you left a “{,}” off or didn’t do something right. Also when it says stuff like::::: Server.class:343 The problem usually isn’t even in that file or that line. Idk why it does it but it happens to me and though I’d let you know, thanks.

That has already been said, all I edited to fix the other problem was the server class.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @QuestMaster_2K10 QuestMaster 2K10
item.description:
@QuestMaster_2K10 wrote:

pl0x15:

Alright I didnt look at you’re real problem or anything and not sure how to fix. But go to the latest thing you edited, which is what I do. And see if you left a “{,}” off or didn’t do something right. Also when it says stuff like::::: Server.class:343 The problem usually isn’t even in that file or that line. Idk why it does it but it happens to me and though I’d let you know, thanks.

Brackets, “{,}” has nothing to do with ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

deathschaos9:

Jmood, just looking at the error it looks like you tried to change the max level from 99 to 1000. Look at getLevelForXP

I didn’t change anything in the Client class.

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:4, topic:337084”][quote author=pl0x15 link=topic=433492.msg3182968#msg3182968 date=1271482397]
Alright I didnt look at you’re real problem or anything and not sure how to fix. But go to the latest thing you edited, which is what I do. And see if you left a “{,}” off or didn’t do something right. Also when it says stuff like::::: Server.class:343 The problem usually isn’t even in that file or that line. Idk why it does it but it happens to me and though I’d let you know, thanks.
[/quote]

Your an idiot.

The array index out of bounds exception was thrown to indicate that an array has been accessed with an illegal index. The index is either negative or greater than or equal to the size of the array.[/quote]

I am still not sure? I am going to be mad when it was something I overlooked. But could someone help me over team viewer, that knows how to fix this.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1000
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

pl0x15:

Alright I didnt look at you’re real problem or anything and not sure how to fix. But go to the latest thing you edited, which is what I do. And see if you left a “{,}” off or didn’t do something right. Also when it says stuff like::::: Server.class:343 The problem usually isn’t even in that file or that line. Idk why it does it but it happens to me and though I’d let you know, thanks.

Your an idiot.

The array index out of bounds exception was thrown to indicate that an array has been accessed with an illegal index. The index is either negative or greater than or equal to the size of the array.

Read full topic
